page.title: 11Ebchester
page.content: Ebchester is a small village, population 1,200, on the east bank of the River Derwent. The A694 runs through Ebchester and the nearest towns are Consett, 4 miles to the south and Newcastle 14 miles to the east. Ebchester is a mixture of very old and modern buildings. The older ones, some more than 200 years,are in cluster in the centre of the village, around the ariginally Norman Church of St Ebba built around 1090 _ 1100 and restored in 1876. Building which cannot be seen from the road are the remnants of a Roman Fort, Vindomora, for Ebchester was a Roman Settlement from about 80 AD. The Commandant's house has been excavated and can be seen at Mains Farm, as can the small museum housing items which have been found.e.g.jewellery,pottery etc.(cont)
